intro: Johannia brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian Johannia, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in humid, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
